entities.description: The process of using data analysis to deduce properties of an underlying probability distribution.
A method used to determine if the observed data deviates significantly from what is expected under a null hypothesis.
The proportion of a population that has a specific characteristic in a given time period.
A range of values that is used to estimate the true value of a population parameter.
A type of statistical test used to compare the means of two groups.
Tests that assume the observations or data points are not influenced by any other observations or data points.
A measure that helps determine the significance of results in hypothesis testing.
The error caused by observing a sample instead of the whole population.

relationships.description: Significance testing is a component of statistical inference used to determine if results are significant.
Statistical analysis often includes the calculation of prevalence rates to understand the distribution of characteristics in a population.
Statistical reports may include confidence intervals to provide estimates of population parameters.
Significance testing may utilize t-tests to compare group means.
Independent tests assume that data points or observations are independent of each other.
The p-value is used to determine the significance of results in hypothesis testing.
Sampling can cause sampling errors because it observes a subset of the population rather than the entire population.
